author: Blog Staff
description:
While C++ doesn’t have native syntax for returning multiple values like some other languages, modern C++ offers powerful tools to accomplish the same goal. With features like std::tuple, structured bindings, std::expected, and std::optional, handling multiple return values—and even error codes—has become both clean and expressive.

Returning several values from a function in C++ (C++23 edition)

by Daniel Lemire

From the article:

Many programming languages such as the Go programming language
title: Returning several values from a function in C++ (C++23 edition) -- Daniel Lemire
